title: Sabarimala gold theft: Probe team arrests 'sponsor' Unnikrishnan
content: Sabarimala gold theft prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti has been taken into custody for detailed interrogation by a special investigation team. Investigators are probing the alleged handover of stolen gold to a Bengaluru-based man. The probe, which has a six-week deadline, is expected to reveal the exact quantity of misappropriated gold.

title: Another blackout in Ukraine: Russian drone & missile attack disrupts power in 8 regions
content: Russia unleashed a massive drone and missile assault, crippling Ukraine's power grid and plunging millions into darkness as winter looms. President Zelenskyy, en route to meet US President Trump, seeks advanced air defense and long-range missiles. Meanwhile, Ukraine targets Russian oil refineries, while a new aviation partnership with a US firm aims to bolster its defense industry.

title: Bihar polls: Manoj Bajpayee calls out RJD's 'patched-up' clip; issues clarification
content: Padma Shri actor Manoj Bajpayee publicly denounced a manipulated campaign video falsely featuring him, shared by the RJD's IT cell. He clarified his non-affiliation with any political party, calling the clip a fake edit. The RJD later deleted the video, but the incident sparked political accusations and highlighted the ongoing high-voltage campaign for the Bihar assembly elections.

title: China outpaces US in power: Economist cites Trump’s energy policies as setback
content: China's electricity generation now surpasses the US by over double, signaling its economic dominance, according to economist Paul Krugman. He criticizes the Trump administration's anti-renewable energy policies, including repealed incentives and canceled grants, as detrimental to US progress and technological competitiveness against China, warning of an irreversible gap by 2028.

title: Australia hit by injury! Green suffers side soreness; Labuschagne steps in
content: Cameron Green is out of the India ODI series with a minor side strain, replaced by in-form Marnus Labuschagne.  Cricket Australia is being cautious ahead of the Ashes.  This setback follows Green's return from spinal surgery.  Other Australian players are also managing injuries, with Jhye Richardson showing promising signs.

title: Last tour for Rohit and Virat? AB de Villiers and Hayden reflect on India stars
content: AB de Villiers and Matthew Hayden express their admiration for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's continued presence in Indian cricket. Both former cricketers highlighted the invaluable mentorship the duo provides, while acknowledging the inevitable end of their careers. They are focused on the 2027 World Cup, with Kohli's current Australian tour potentially being his last.

title: Bengaluru: 20-year-old BPharma student stabbed to death by ex-boyfriend
content: A 20-year-old B Pharmacy student was fatally stabbed near railway tracks in Srirampura by her former boyfriend, Vignesh, after she repeatedly rejected his attempts to reconcile. The victim had previously complained to police about Vignesh's harassment. Vignesh, who has a prior arrest for extortion, is currently at large.

title: AI replacing jobs: Sam Altman questions importance of some roles; uses farmer’s example
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman suggested that jobs transformed by AI might not be considered "real work" in the future, drawing a comparison to how a farmer from the past might view modern occupations. This perspective, he stated, makes him "a little less worried" about potential job losses, believing human drives will lead to new pursuits.

title: Who is Shannon Kobylarczyk? Milwaukee Brewers fan controversy explained
content: A viral video from a Brewers-Dodgers game captured a Milwaukee attorney, Shannon Kobylarczyk, making a racially charged remark and threatening to call ICE on a U.S. Navy veteran. The incident led to Kobylarczyk's termination from her job, resignation from a charity board, and a ban from the stadium. The veteran, Ricardo Fosado, expressed sympathy for her.

title: Gold rates at record highs, hit $4,379.93/ounce; US credit & China woes fuel surge
content: Gold and silver have reached unprecedented levels. Investors are flocking to safe havens amid worries about US credit and escalating US-China friction. Federal Reserve rate cut expectations are also fueling this rally. Silver has surpassed its 1980 record. Palladium and platinum have also seen significant gains this week.

title: Rohit’s first interaction with Gambhir after stepping down as ODI captain - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma returns to action for India against Australia after stepping down as ODI captain, with Shubman Gill now leading the side.  Sharma was seen training intensely with coach Gautam Gambhir and batting alongside Virat Kohli, a nostalgic sight for fans. This tour could be a final appearance in Australia for the veteran duo.

title: MacKenzie Scott cuts Amazon stake by 42%; now holds $12.6bn; prioritises equity work
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, cutting holdings by nearly 42% to $12.6 billion. This reduction occurred despite Amazon's stock performance and follows her extensive philanthropic efforts, which have heavily focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. The exact reasons for the stake reduction, whether sales or donations, remain unspecified.

title: Uttar Pradesh’s agriculture model wins praise from World Bank chief
content: World Bank President Ajay Banga lauded Uttar Pradesh's agriculture model for small farmers as a global benchmark for sustainable farming and climate adaptation. He highlighted the integration of climate-tolerant seeds, regenerative techniques, and digital technology as key to empowering farmers and ensuring financial inclusion.

title: Top stocks to buy: Recommendations for October 17 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research highlights Reliance Industries and Suzlon Energy as top stock picks for October 17, 2025. The Nifty is poised for further gains, targeting 25,900 and 26,200, while Bank Nifty shows a bullish structure and aims for 58,000.

title: 'Insufficient evidence': US appeals court blocks Trump's request to send National Guard to Chicago
content: A US appeals court has blocked President Trump's order to deploy the National Guard in Chicago, citing a lack of evidence for rebellion or danger. The court found that protests against immigration policies, even if spirited, do not justify such a deployment. This ruling follows similar challenges from Illinois, Oregon, and California against the administration's use of federal troops domestically.

title: Gabrielle Union celebrates father’s 81st birthday amid his life-threatening illness
content: Gabrielle Union celebrated her father's 81st birthday with a heartfelt Instagram message, expressing gratitude for their connection despite his ongoing battle with dementia. She shared touching moments, including his joy at seeing her and Dwyane Wade. Their daughter Kaavia also posted a touching tribute to her grandpa with an emotional post reflecting back to the time when she held his arms for first time.

title: Aaron Rodgers’ secret wife Brittani sparks mystery over private marriage
content: Aaron Rodgers, now with the Steelers, keeps his wife Brittani a complete mystery. Despite his public return to football, no photos or public appearances of her exist, and even teammates haven't met her. Rodgers emphasizes her desire for privacy, stating she didn't sign up for celebrity life. He credits her with profoundly changing his world and being his unwavering support.

title: MLB rumors: Phillies target $54M Mets star to replace Kyle Schwarber
content: Philadelphia Phillies face a crucial offseason with Kyle Schwarber's free agency. Former GM Jim Bowden suggests targeting New York Mets star Pete Alonso as a logical replacement. Alonso offers durability, defensive versatility at first base, and is younger than Schwarber, making him an intriguing, albeit potentially costly, alternative if Schwarber departs.

title: All Mega Evolutions ranked in Pokemon Legends: Z-A — full tier list
content: Pokemon Legends: Z-A has unveiled exciting new Mega Evolutions, transforming beloved creatures like Zygarde and Greninja into formidable forces. This tier list ranks these powerful forms based on battle prowess, accessibility, and strategic typing, offering players a guide to the game's most impactful transformations. Discover which Megas dominate the battlefield.

title: Pakistan in crisis! Captain Salman Agha sacked after Asia Cup losses to India - Report
content: Pakistan Cricket Board is set to replace Salman Ali Agha with Shadab Khan as T20I captain following three consecutive Asia Cup 2025 losses to India. This strategic reset ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup will be implemented once Shadab recovers from shoulder surgery next month.

title: How an Indian legend helped this star Australian batter ahead of the India series
content: Marnus Labuschagne is on the verge of an Ashes recall, fueled by a remarkable domestic resurgence.  Inspired by Virender Sehwag's aggressive batting, the Australian star has notched four centuries in five matches.  After a lean period, Labuschagne's renewed confidence and proactive approach, focusing on seeing and hitting the ball, have seen him scoring freely again.

title: Not just cholesterol: This overlooked blood test can signal stroke risk
content: High homocysteine levels pose a serious risk to heart health and brain function. This often-ignored amino acid can damage blood vessels and lead to blood clots. Research indicates levels above 15 µmol/L are classified as elevated and are associated with an increased risk of ischemic stroke and other vascular events.

title: Ashes: Leaked tapes, tax woes - The shocking fall of England’s WC-winning captain
content: England's assistant coach Paul Collingwood is reportedly out of the Ashes backroom team due to personal reasons, following a series of controversies. These include leaked explicit tapes, a strip club incident before a T20 World Cup match, and a recent £196,000 tax bill from HMRC.

title: Scientists add bacteria to waste gas reactor – unexpected results follow
content: Norwegian scientists have engineered a process using specialized bacteria to convert industrial waste gases, carbon dioxide and hydrogen, into nearly pure methane. This biologically produced fuel, exceeding 96% purity, can be used in existing natural gas systems, offering a sustainable solution for storing renewable energy and replacing fossil fuels.

title: Sophie Rain reveals: What she’s saving for husband despite huge earnings vs LeBron
content: OnlyFans star Sophie Rain revealed she earned nearly as much as LeBron James in 2024 without posting nudes, emphasizing her Christian values. She aims to reach $100 million on the platform, proving that explicit content isn't the only path to wealth. James, meanwhile, has expressed financial anxieties despite his vast fortune.

title: Indian convict among criminals arrested by ICE amid U.S. shutdown
content: ICE said its enforcement teams apprehended individuals convicted of serious crimes, including rape, child sexual abuse, and drug trafficking

title: Air India has scaled up flight services from Thiruvananthapuram: Kerala CM
content: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan pleased with Air India’s decision to restore flight services from Thiruvananthapuram International Airport, enhancing air connectivity in Kerala

title: Jubilee Hills by-election nomination processions: Hyderabad Traffic Police announce series of diversions on October 17
content: Commuters have been advised to avoid routes leading towards the Kotla Vijaya Bhaskar Reddy Indoor stadium and use alternate roads

title: Case registered over fake claims about electoral rolls circulating on social media
content: Election officials have urged the public not to believe or share unverified information concerning electoral rolls and have warned that strict action will be taken

title: CBI arrests Punjab DIG on graft charges; ₹5 crore cash, Mercedes, luxury watches seized
content: The CBI seized jewellery weighing about 1.5 kg, keys of two luxury vehicles (Mercedes and Audi), 22 luxury watches, locker keys, 40 litres of imported liquor

title: Bald truths: the high cost of quick-fix hair cures
content: Pop-up hair treatment camps and miracle regrowth schemes are preying on men’s insecurities, promising instant fixes but leaving a trail of burns, infections and empty wallets. Urban tragedy unfolds in Hyderabad as men fall prey to scams, revealing the emotional turmoil of baldness

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: JD(U), LJP(RV), and RLM release lists; NDA names all 243 candidates
content: After prolonged negotiations, the Mahagatbandhan managed to settle the seat division between the allies

title: Sabarimala gold ‘theft’ case: Kerala SIT arrests prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti
content: Before formal arrest, the SIT escorted Mr. Potti to the General Hospital in Thiruvananthapuram for a detailed medical examination

title: Man dies of asphyxiation while cleaning septic tank in Ranipet
content: Police say that the victim did not respond after he went inside the tank; two others who tried to save the victim fell unconscious. Both of them have been admitted at a private hospital

title: UN today still reflects realities of 1945, not of 2025; it must reform: EAM Jaishankar
content: The EAM underscored the need to "recalibrate" global peacekeeping efforts in tune with evolving realities

title: Durgapur gang rape case: Bengal has second-lowest conviction rate for crimes against women
content: Between 2017 and 2023, only around one in five cases of crimes against women ended in convictions in West Bengal

title: Indian peacekeepers carved special place for themselves, earned goodwill: President Murmu
content: President Droupadi Murmu praises Indian peacekeepers for their gender inclusion, community empowerment, and dedication to United Nations peacekeeping missions

title: Know thy villain | Review of The Menon Investigation by Saharu Nusaiba Kannanari
content: In this police procedural set in Kerala, male protagonists are the victims of an unjust patriarchal society

title: Candlelight before codification
content: In Beawar, Rajasthan, the birthplace of the Right to Information movement, people reckon with a looming setback while celebrating 20 years of a historic law. Aroon Deep finds that even as groups from across India gather to rejoice at the citizen wins, they protest its erosion in several ways, especially by the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023

title: NDA will return to power in Bihar with thumping majority: Chhattisgarh CM
content: Vishnu Deo Sai said that Bihar has witnessed tremendous growth under the leadership of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar.

title: Digvijaya Singh alleges SIR aimed at 'vote theft', says INDIA bloc will protest with proof
content: Singh accused the BJP of having 62 lakh voters removed from the electoral rolls in Bihar to influence assembly elections. He asserted, however, that the alliance in Bihar would still form the government.

title: West Bengal Congress submits demands to CEO for modification of SIR process
content: The WBPCC’s memorandum listed out 16-point demands like the inclusion of electoral rolls since 2002 till that of the Assembly election in 2021 as probative evidence of eligibility and citizenship of a voter

title: Urban local bodies in Ernakulam achieve 80% coverage in doorstep waste collection by volunteers
content: Kochi Corporation and 13 municipalities in Ernakulam achieve total coverage of 96% and 85% respectively in deployment of volunteers

title: HC slams slack cooperation between Centre and State in cleaning up Periyar
content: High Court orders competent authority at the Centre to hold talks with State Environment Secretary to find a viable solution to pollution of the river, including identifying an alternative site for effluent treatment

title: Russia confident of continuing energy trade with India: Deputy PM Novak
content: The U.S. president claimed that while India may not be able to cut the procurement immediately, the process has started.

title: Bid to politicise, give caste colour to Haryana IPS officer death case ‘inappropriate’, says Union Urban Affairs Minister Manohar Lal
content: Justice will be delivered to both families, a ‘social evil’ central to the incidents, he says after meeting kin of ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather; last rites performed at Julana after post-mortem

title:
No MNS joining MVA proposal yet: Sapkal; Raut denies writing 
to Cong. against State party chief
content: When asked about the possibility of Mr. Raj Thackeray’s inclusion in the MVA, Mr. Sapkal said the delegation which had gone to meet the Election Commission had nothing to do with the allianc

title: Northeast monsoon sets in with intense rain forecast across Tamil Nadu till October 22
content: It marks an early onset, ahead of its usual date of October 20. The RMC has issued an orange alert for five districts today; Chennai will continue to experience light to moderate rainfall till October 18

title: Potholes cause chaos on road linking Medavakkam, Sholinganallur: residents
content: Traffic congestion caused by Metrorail work, haphazard parking of vehicles on the narrow road and violation of road rules, they say. Former engineer dismisses possibility of widening the road

title: Why Indians Won't Be Eligible For US Green Card Lottery This Year
content: Indian nationals have been excluded from the United States Diversity Visa (DV) lottery, at least until 2028.

title: Sabarimala Sponsor Unnikrishnan Potti Arrested In Gold Theft Case
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) appointed by the Kerala High Court to probe the Sabarimala gold robbery case arrested the prime accused, Unnikrishnan Potti early Friday.

title: West Champaran To Kosi Heartland, How Top BJP Leaders Will Cover Bihar
content: Under the banner of "Mission Bihar", the NDA's high-octane blitz aims to consolidate support and counter anti-incumbency by saturating key regions.

title: Can't "Deplete" Stock: Trump Casts Doubt On Giving Tomahawks To Ukraine
content: President Donald Trump cast doubt Thursday on giving Tomahawk missiles to Kyiv a day before he meets with Ukraine's leader Volodymyr Zelensky, saying the United States could not "deplete" its own stock.

title: NDTV World Summit 2025 LIVE: Stage Set For Global Dialogue, PM Modi To Speak Today
content: NDTV Global World Summit 2025 LIVE Updates: The 2025 edition of the NDTV World Summit - NDTV's flagship event - begins today, and will feature a host of leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Farmer Injured in Tiger Attack In Karnataka
content: A terrifying tiger attack in Badagalapura village, Saragur taluk in Mysuru district was caught on video, showing villagers desperately climbing trees to save themselves as the big cat charged at them in a field.

title: Madagascar's New Military Leader Says Power Grab "Was Not A Coup"
content: Madagascar's Colonel Michael Randrianirina insisted on the eve of his swearing in as new leader on Friday that a military power grab that sent President Andry Rajoelina fleeing the island was "not a coup".

title: "Diwali Loot": HD Kumaraswamy Slams Bengaluru Property Conversion Scheme
content: Union Minister HD Kumaraswamy has strongly criticised the Karnataka government's newly announced B-Khata to A-Khata conversion scheme in Bengaluru, questioning its affordability for ordinary citizens.

title: Ahead Of Winter, Delhi Steps Up Measures To Combat Air Pollution
content: Delhi's winter anti-pollution plan for 2025-26 is now active, with authorities stepping up measures across dust control, vehicles, construction, industry, waste, and stubble burning as the city braces for seasonal pollution.

title: US Chamber Of Commerce Sues Team Trump Over $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee
content: The US Chamber of Commerce is suing the Trump administration for imposing a $100,00 annual fee for new H-1B visa applications, claiming the fee is unlawful and would significantly harm US businesses.

title: 'Thrilled, Looking Forward To Meeting PM Modi At NDTV World Summit': Rishi Sunak
content: Britain's former prime minister Rishi Sunak said he is thrilled and looking forward to participating at the NDTV World Summit to be held in Delhi on Friday and Saturday.

title: US Carries Out New Strike Against Suspected Drug Vessel In Caribbean
content: The US military carried out a new strike on Thursday against a suspected drug vessel in the Caribbean, and in what is believed to be the first such case, there were survivors among the crew, a US official told Reuters.

title: Former KISS Guitarist Ace Frehley Dies At 74
content: Ace Frehley, the original lead guitarist for US glam rock group KISS, has died, his family said. He was 74.

title: Zelensky Arrives In Washington For Arms Talks With Trump
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky hopes the momentum of the Middle East peace deal will help end the war in Ukraine, he said Thursday after arriving in the US for arms talks.

title: Trump Says Expects To Meet Putin Within 2 Weeks
content: US President Donald Trump said Thursday that he expected a meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in the Hungarian capital Budapest to happen in the coming two weeks.

title: Canada, US Airports Hacked With Pro-Hamas, Anti-Trump Messages
content: Hackers took over the public address systems on Tuesday at four airports, three in Canada and one in the United States, to broadcast messages praising Hamas and criticizing President Donald Trump, according to officials and news reports.

title: Former Trump Adviser John Bolton Indicted In Classified Documents Case
content: John Bolton, Donald Trump's former national security advisor, was indicted Thursday by a federal grand jury, the third foe of the US president to be hit with criminal charges in recent weeks.

title: Top US Admiral To Step Down Amid Tensions With Venezuela
content: The US admiral who leads US military forces in Latin America will step down at the end of this year, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced on Thursday, in a surprise move that comes amid escalating tensions with Venezuela.

title: Ukrainian Drone Kills Russian State Media Correspondent
content: A Russian state media correspondent was killed in a Ukrainian drone strike in the Moscow-occupied part of Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia region, his outlet, the news agency RIA Novosti, said Thursday.

title: Trump Threatens To "Go In And Kill" Hamas If Gaza Killings Continue
content: President Donald Trump on Thursday warned Hamas "we will have no choice but to go in and kill them" if internal bloodshed persists in Gaza.

title: Molly Qerim exit sparks outrage: Fans demand her return to ESPN’s First Take
content: Molly Qerim's abrupt departure from ESPN's First Take has sparked considerable discussion. Chris "Mad Dog" Russo revealed Stephen A. Smith contacted him prior to Qerim's exit, suggesting she may have felt embarrassed by leaks and sought to avoid being a "lame duck" host. ESPN has since named Shae Cornette as her permanent replacement.

title: Jonathan Kuminga’s outburst stuns Warriors in heated preseason showdown
content: Golden State Warriors' Jonathan Kuminga was ejected and fined $35,000 for inappropriate contact with a referee during a preseason game against the Portland Trail Blazers. Coach Steve Kerr, however, praised Kuminga's passion and intensity despite the dismissal. Kuminga expressed frustration over a perceived missed foul, recalling a past ankle injury.

title: Charlie Puth announces he’s expecting first child with wife Brooke Sansone
content: Charlie Puth is stepping into a new chapter of life: fatherhood. The 33-year-old singer-songwriter revealed on Thursday, October 16, that he and his wife, Brooke Sansone, are expecting their first child together. True to his artistic style, the announcement came with a signature creative twist — through a scene in the music video for his latest single, Changes.

title: Josh Allen opens up: Life lessons from wife Hailee Steinfeld beyond football
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen revealed his marriage to Hailee Steinfeld has profoundly impacted his life, helping him realize he's "more than a football player."  He described their wedding day as the most significant event, even surpassing career milestones.  The couple actively supports each other's demanding careers, demonstrating a strong partnership built on shared values and personal growth.

title: MSME Minister Kondapalli Srinivas visits Switzerland and Germany to explore industrial collaborations
content: He attends a series of high-level meetings and discusses areas of interest with CEOs of Fuchs Design AG and FyrstGen

title: Frequent jams around ORR spill on to connecting roads, make school travel a nightmare for children
content: The ripple effect of traffic from the Outer Ring Road, coupled with narrow lanes, has become a major concern for commuters on connecting roads, particularly for school buses, as vehicles crawl along these stretches every day during peak hours

title: Prime Minister Modi pats Andhra Pradesh for successful conduct of GST campaign
content: In a post on X, he specially appreciated IT Minister Nara Lokesh for organising the campaign that deepened the understanding of reforms among youth

title: Days after hosting Taliban Foreign Minister, India says ‘fully committed’ to Afghan ‘sovereignty and territorial integrity’
content: The statement is in the backdrop of cross-border clashes between Kabul and Islamabad earlier this week

title: Rahul Gandhi’s visit to lynching victim’s kin will reaffirm stand against injustice: Congress leader
content: Valmiki, the victim, was cornered by a mob who accused him of being a member of a gang marking houses with drones for theft; he was beaten with belts and sticks and died soon after

title: Russia backs AMCA programme, offers to make Su-57 jets in India
content: Following U.S. President Donald Trump’s claim that India will halt its oil purchase from Russia, Russian Ambassador to India Denis Alipov says “Russian energy remains the most cost-effective option on the global market”

title: Government of India raised issue of anti-India rallies in Australia: Minister Anne Aly
content: “I want to reassure everyone that the divisive rhetoric expressed at the anti-migration rallies is not shared by the overwhelming majority of Australians,” says Ms. Aly

title: Experts bat for more space for social sector in mainstream media
content: Civil society and media representatives urge collaboration, training, and editorial focus to strengthen social sector coverage

title: Sri Lankan PM Harini Amarasuriya takes a trip down memory lane at her alma mater in Delhi, praising India’s diversity
content: She studied at Hindu College in 1991, and urged current students to “never underestimate the power of asking difficult questions”; says India-SL partnersip is “not episodical”, but “structural”

title: After hectic parleys, Mahagatbandhan manages to settle seat-sharing deal
content: As Vikassheel Insaan Party’s Mukesh Sahani played hardball and the Rashtriya Janata Dal remained intractable, the CPI(ML) and the Congress played peacemakers during the discussion for the seat distribution for the Bihar polls; VIP likely to get 15 seats; Congress announces list of 48 candidates for first and second phases

title: ‘Disproportionate growth’ in assets of BJP MP Nishikant Dubey’s wife: Congress
content: Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate says there is “no consistency” between Anamika Gautam’s declared income and assets over the years

title: Government targets ₹3 lakh crore in domestic defence production by 2029: Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister says exports to touch ₹50,000 crore; credits private sector for driving India’s self-reliance push

title: JD(U), LJP(RV), and RLM release lists; NDA names all 243 candidates
content: The JD(U) has made a caste balance in the list giving maximum number to tickets to the OBC with 37 candidates, 22 candidates each belongs from Extremely Backward Classes and upper castes.

title: Pre-test for Census first phase to be held from November 10
content: Government notification provides option to self-enumerate; the order appears to imply the methodology to enumerate caste is not ready yet

title: Three technical glitches on Bengaluru metro’s Yellow Line stretch in three months of launch
content: Responding to concerns about the repeated glitches, a senior official from the BMRCL says the problems were minor and not very serious

title: Women with metabolic syndrome face higher risk of gynaecological cancers, finds study
content: Metabolic syndrome is a complex cluster of metabolic disorders that includes obesity and hypertension among others

title: Cabinet decides to procure entire paddy harvest, wait for legal opinion on  BC reservations
content: 50% local quota in NALSAR admissions and Committee on Metro Rail expansion are major Cabinet decisions

title: Tej Pratap carries photo of grandmother to file poll papers from Mahua
content: Ousted from the RJD for six years following a controversy, Tej Pratap Yadav has floated the Janshakti Janata Dal and has fielded 20 candidates till now for the upcoming Assembly election

title: Abujhmad, North Bastar regions free of Maoists: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister says 258 cadres surrendered in two days; government aiming to “decimate Naxalism before the 31st of March 2026”

title: Chhattisgarh High Court upholds cancellation of forest rights of villagers in Hasdeo Arand forest where Adani runs coal mines
content: A Single Bench of Justice Rakesh Mohan Pandey stated that granting the community forest rights in itself was a “mistake” that was “rectified” through the cancellation, concluding that this made the order granting the rights “void ab initio”

title: Kochi school may approach HC against ‘adverse’ findings in DDE’s report in Hijab row
content: The Parent Teacher Association president says the management has entrusted its counsel to check the legal recourse to be adopted as the report had falsely claimed that the school authorities had stopped the student from attending the classes after her parents insisted on wearing hijab

title: Karnataka Cabinet approves Bengaluru Business Corridor to connect Electronic City with Mysuru, Tumakuru roads
content: The 117 km tolled corridor will be developed by BDA in two years by giving five options of compensation for land-losers

title: Andhra Pradesh receives ‘normal’ rainfall during Southwest Monsoon
content: Between June 1 and September 30 this year, the State received 530.9 mm rainfall, which is higher than the normal of 521.6 mm, but is the second lowest in the past five years, according to the India Meteorological Department in Amaravati

title: HAL’s third LCA Tejas production line in Nashik boosts India’s indigenous aerospace capabilities
content: HAL’s 13 lakh sq.ft. facility in Nashik will have the capacity to manufacture eight Tejas Mk1A aircraft per year, allowing for expedited deliveries to the IAF

title: Delegation submits memorandum to CM seeking to extend Sabari Rail to Vizhinjam
content: Proposal envisages connecting Sabari Rail to Vizhinjam port via Nedumangad by developing Kattakada, Nedumangad, Venjaramoodu and Kilimanoor as suburbs of Thiruvananthapuram

title: Genco complains about low quality coal supplies from Singareni
content: CMD of Genco writes to his SCCL counterparts stating that low grade coal is affecting generating units’ performance, resulting in revenue loss

title: Young JSP supporter electrocuted at PM Modi’s meeting venue in Kurnool
content: The accident took place when the flagpole the youth was carrying came in contact with overhead power line

title: Guns, gold, and criminal cases: what election affidavits of leaders reveal
content: Tejashwi Yadav and his family have total assets worth ₹8.98 crore; JD(U) leader Anant Singh has declared total assets of ₹37.88 crore and the former don has 28 criminal cases pending against him

title: Manikanth Rathod says Priyank Kharge should tender apology for RSS ban statement
content: He questions the language Priyank Kharge uses for Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Administrative reforms commission recommends closure of seven boards and corporations, and merger of nine others
content: Amid the ongoing process of political appointments to various boards and corporations, the Karnataka Administrative Reforms Commission-2 has recommended closure of seven bodies and merger of nine others with those with overlapping functions

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu predicts NDA victory in Bihar
content: The 21st century belongs to Modi and his victory march should continue for ensuring Viksit Bharat, he says

title: Dodgers roll in G3, near repeat World Series trip
content: Tommy Edman hit a tiebreaking single off hard-throwing rookie Jacob Misiorowski in a two-run sixth inning, and the Dodgers beat the Brewers 3-1 on Thursday to take a 3-0 lead in the NL Championship Series.

title: Cignetti gets new 8-year, $93M deal at Indiana
content: Indiana announced a new eight-year contract with coach Curt Cignetti worth nearly $93 million Thursday.

title: Parsons calls out one-sided officiating, tush push
content: Micah Parsons made his feelings known Thursday on offensive players getting away with holding far too often and his disdain for the Eagles' tush push play.

title: Amid rumors, Saints' Kamara wants to stay put
content: Saints running back Alvin Kamara and wide receiver Chris Olave were asked about the rampant trade rumors surrounding them Thursday.

title: 49ers' Kittle: 'Fully plan' to return vs. Falcons
content: George Kittle, who has been out with a hamstring injury since the season opener, said he plans to play Sunday when San Francisco hosts Atlanta.

title: Phillies' brass hopes Harper can be 'elite' again
content: Phillies president of baseball operations Dave Dombrowski wonders if two-time NL MVP Bryce Harper can return to "elite" form with six years left on his 13-year, $330 million deal.

title: Bucks, Green agree to 4-year, $45M extension
content: Bucks guard AJ Green has agreed to a four-year, $45 million fully guaranteed contract extension with the franchise, agent Matt Bollero of ProMondo Sports told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Pistons' Ivey has knee surgery, delaying return
content: Pistons guard Jaden Ivey's long-awaited return hit a snag as he will miss the next four weeks following right knee surgery.

title: 🏈 Week 7 fantasy playbook: Lineup locks, more
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL. games.

title: The NFL trade deadline dream scenario: Barnwell proposes 13 trades that need to happen
content: Jakobi Meyers to the NFC East? Trey Hendrickson and Jaelan Phillips to the same team? Russell Wilson to a contender? Let's build 13 win-win trades.

title: 'The culture had gotten really tight': How Penn State unraveled under James Franklin
content: Penn State entered the season with national title aspirations. Six games in, the school fired its coach.

title: The NHL's small-sample shock teams: Who has under- and overperformed?

title: RS poll: NC reaches out to Mufti for support; PDP links backing to ‘anti-bulldozer’ bill

title: ‘Darbar’ move: Omar to restore tradition; J&K capital to shift to Jammu for winters
content: the tradition involves rotating J&K's seat of government . the practice dates back to 1872 when Maharaja Gulab Singh started it . reviving the historic move will boost jammu and Kashmir's people .

title: Udhampur: Cordon and search op under way; terror suspect threatened locals
content: a joint team of security forces launched an intensive cordon-and-search operation in Latti area of J&K’s Udhampur district . locals reported that a group of terror suspects had entered a house in Kirchi village, threatened its residents and fled after allegedly snatching cash . authorities urge people to flag any suspicious movement in their respective areas .
